本編のみならず、ユーザー独自に作った新作もレベルが高くて楽しめる。
コスパがいいなどという言葉を言ったら失礼なくらい満足度が高い。
でも安くなってるから、気楽に試してもらいたい。決して失望はさせません。
次のゲームを探しているが、Portal2　には全く及ばないので選択に悩んでいるほど。

Este juego es un (g)old buenísimo, si bien es mucha lógica también la parte cooperativa es muy divertida! espero que le den una oportunidad a este juego! les recomiendo jugar Portal y después Portal 2 :3

Singleplayer; me encanta como continua el primer juego, las cinematicas y el aspecto grafico, al igual que lase referencias y momentos comicos, la historia no es la ams increible pero es entretenida, y todos ya saben lo revolucionario de sus mecanicas, para finalizar que buena cancion.
Co-op: es divertido y original, pero de verdad se siente en los mapas que fue hecho un poco a la rapida en texturas y los alrededores.
Good luck attempting to find a negative review.

Yes, I would recommend this game, even for the age of it. The puzzles are fun and some are inquisitive. Not exactly sure how far I am but I am at least half way through, which really amped up the difficulty on the puzzles. Co-op is always available so you can grab a friend and it might be a separate story for co-op and single player. By the way the story is fantastic so far.

A masterclass in puzzle design, Portal 2 has stood the test of time very well! Graphically and performance-wise, this game still stands a notch above most other modern games, being handled very well by my modern system. The story-line and lore still hold up, and I still tear up when I think about the tragedy of Cave Johnson & Caroline. On replaying this game, I found that the puzzles were still very rewarding to try and solve logically, and though I was stumped on a few, I was eventually able to figure out the solution once I remembered to stop thinking so linearly: to beat Portal 2, you have to think with portals!

Overall, I give Portal 2 a solid 10/10, and I cannot wait to start on the Cooperative Testing Initiative!

this game masterfully combines psychological horror, humor, platforming, puzzles, and physical gameplay into what can only be described as a wanna be quantum physicist's wet dream. I do not have the words to describe just how much I love this game, and how beautifully it expands off of the admittedly bland linear concept of the original game story-wise.
